title: issue #360: Add support for committing multiple files
body:
Implement #360. New classes:
- GHBlobBuilder - [create a blob](https://developer.github.com/v3/git/blobs/#create-a-blob)
- GHTreeBuilder - [create a tree](https://developer.github.com/v3/git/trees/#create-a-tree)
- GHCommitBuilder - [create a commit](https://developer.github.com/v3/git/commits/#create-a-commit)

[This gist](https://gist.github.com/siordache/63b19f515e4db6944e2411265f89e92f) shows how to use the new classes.

title: Add support for committing multiple files.
body:
A single file can be committed by using one of the GHRepository.createContent() methods.

In order to commit multiple files, the following steps have to be taken:
1. Get the SHA of the latest commit on the branch
2. Get the tree information for that commit
3. **Create a new tree for your commit**
4. **Create the commit**
5. Link commit to the reference

The operations in steps 3 and 4 are currently not suppported by github-api. They involve:
- [creating a blob](https://developer.github.com/v3/git/blobs/#create-a-blob)
- [creating a tree](https://developer.github.com/v3/git/trees/#create-a-tree)
- [creating a commit](https://developer.github.com/v3/git/commits/#create-a-commit)

Do you find the addition of these operations useful? If yes, I will create a PR for this.

title: Update GHPullRequest with missing properties
body:
As per https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/#get-a-single-pull-request

`locked` - read/write, https://developer.github.com/v3/issues/#unlock-an-issue
`commits` - read only
`maintainer_can_modify` - read/write, https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/#update-a-pull-request

title: Updating file is not possible
body:
Updating a file is not possible with `GHRepository.createContent(...)`. None of the methods accept the required `sha` argument. See https://developer.github.com/enterprise/2.9/v3/repos/contents/#update-a-file

> sha	string	Required. The blob SHA of the file being replaced.

Full stacktrace:

title: Refactor to allow for additional HTTP headers
body:
For new/experimental functionality, the GitHub API requires the submission of an additional header to enable features (see, for example, the [API documentation note](https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/) below related to the new Topics attributes):

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10222432/24561770/15a10854-1616-11e7-97a3-cf9b61987b87.png)

Currently while the HTTP mechanisms are well-factored, they are only plugable via changes to the source code of this library.  To ease extensibility (and meet the needs of additional headers), please consider either: 
 - Implementing a Factory-style improvement that would allow for us to provide a ```Requester``` that could, for examlpe include the headers within the implementation of ```buildRequest```, or
 - Provide a pathway for injecting headers into the ```Requester```'s ```headers``` property, possibly via a static-level "DefaultHeaders" that is publicly available.

See also: https://developer.github.com/v3/search/#search-commits

title: Add application/json header when sending json data.
body:
I'm using Jenkins and SonarQube GitHub plugins with [GitBucket](https://github.com/gitbucket/gitbucket).
GitBucket has GitHub-compatible API.
But it is not 100% compatible. This PR solves one of the differences between GitHub and GitBucket. And, it also solves header and body data format mismatch when sending json data.

in current version's Requester.java [buildRequest](https://github.com/kohsuke/github-api/blob/2627dc5ee4ed60c0250ce5a9e99d586d480603f2/src/main/java/org/kohsuke/github/Requester.java#L385) sends json data with content-type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded.
This behavior is incorrect. data and header mismatch. Then, GitBucket was confused by how to handle data.

In GitHub API, GitHub parses this data as json (header content-type is ignored), but this behavior is not documented. In the future this behavior may change.

I think that it is better to accept this modification to avoid future problems.

title: GHRepository stargazers, watchers etc is always zero
Ensure that connections are closed for error responses
body:
- This was endless fun to trace, but I found it at last. This should
stop the `WARNING: A connection to https://api.github.com/ was leaked.
Did you forget to close a response body?` messages in the logs when
using the OkHttpConnector.

@reviewbybees

Return code is: 502 , ReasonPhrase:Bad Gateway. -> [Help 1]```

I also checked https://repo.jenkins-ci.org/public/org/jenkins-ci/jenkins/1.26/jenkins-1.26.pom, but its giving 504 TIMEOUT.
Is anybody facing this too?

title: getPusher() returns null in call to getPusher()
body:
I have a github enterprise installation.   I'm trying to get Jenkins connected to it.  When I set up a repo and turn on 'GitHub hook trigger for GITScm polling', I see the hook get created in my repo, however it has a Red Triangle icon.  Hovering over it says 'Invalid HTTP Reponse: 0'.

When I look at the Jenkins log, I see github tried to post an event, but I see the following error:

java.lang.NullPointerException

Interestingly enough, if I take the same payload and put it in a JSON, I can post the even manually using curl:
$ curl -X POST --header "Content-Type: application/json" --header "X-GitHub-Event: push" -d @data.json http://XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX:8080/github-webhook/ -v
* About to connect() to proxy proxy-server port 8080 (#0)

>

< Server: Jetty(9.2.z-SNAPSHOT)
< Proxy-Connection: Keep-Alive

* Connection #0 to host proxy-server left intact
* Closing connection #0


Looking at the code in org.jenkinsci.plugins.github.webhook.subscriber.DefaultPushGHEventSubscriber.onEvent(DefaultPushGHEventSubscriber.java:77), it looks like the call to getPusher is null. 

In deed, when I put the json in a unit test, getPusher returns null.

title: How can I get Latest Release of Repository?
improved branch protection support
body: this PR will improves the support around protected branches and bring it inline w/ the current api. what is currently there doesn't work (properly at least) and given how i interpreted the `@Preview` docs, this seems inline.

title: Expose Headers
body: Fixes #303 Bit shocked with design, this info is needed for normal and failed requests, so added GHObject field injector and wrapped exceptions. Not sure only whether it possible to change throwing exception types without breaking compatibility. cc @stephenc your github-branch-org-source should be also affected if it close to non single admin token use case. --- This change isвЂ‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/kohsuke/github-api/339)

as of Java 8

title: Fetching the issue URI for repositories with no issues
body:
Hello.

I want to retrieve the issue API URI for a repository that, despite having issues enabled, has not yet actually had any issues filed. It seems that I need to get access to a value of type `GHIssue` in order to call the `getApiURL` on it, but in a repository that has no available issues, I can't!

What's the correct way to do this? Do I need to manually construct the URI myself?

title: Add support for MergeMethod on GHPullRequest
body:
- Add 'polaris' preview
- Add MergeMethod Enum
- Add merge method to GHPullRequest which takes a MergeMethod

Fixes #326
